justification: The data clump with key 58 is chosen because it affects a significant number of files (41), which implies that any changes to the parameters or the method signature would require updates across many parts of the codebase. This can lead to a high risk of introducing bugs and makes the code harder to maintain. By refactoring this data clump, we can encapsulate the parameters into a single object, reducing the impact on multiple files and improving the maintainability of the code.
